name: InstallTopshelfService
description: Installs a TopShelf service using the standard command line options for Topshelf 4.0.
author: Michael Barry

inputs.name: TopshelfExePaths
inputs.label: Topshelf Exe Paths
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full path to topshelf executables. (Comma separated list)

inputs.name: EnvironmentName
inputs.label: Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a comma separated list of machine IP addresses or FQDNs.
Eg: dbserver.fabrikam.com,192.168.12.34
Or provide output variable of other tasks. Eg: $(variableName)

inputs.name: AdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator login for the target machines.

inputs.name: AdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for administrator login for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: protocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the network protocol to use for the WinRM connection with the machine(s). The default is HTTPS.

inputs.name: TestCertificate
inputs.label: Test Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to skip validating the authenticity of the machine's certificate from a trusted certification authority. The parameter is required for the WinRM HTTPS protocol.

inputs.name: RunPowershellInParallel
inputs.label: Run PowerShell in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will run the PowerShell scripts in parallel on the target machines.

inputs.name: specialUser
inputs.label: Special User
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the network protocol to use for the WinRM connection with the machine(s). The default is HTTPS.

inputs.name: ServiceUsername
inputs.label: Service Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Username to run the service as.

inputs.name: StartupType
inputs.label: Service Startup Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the startup type for the service.

inputs.name: UninstallFirst
inputs.label: UnInstall service first
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check to uninstall the services before installation, effectivly resetting any manual changes. This will also stop services if running. (not reccomend as timeout it not controllable)

inputs.name: KillMmcTaskManager
inputs.label: Before uninstall kill all mmc\taskmgr
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check to make the task kill all open instances of mmc and taskmgr in an attempt to avoid the dreaded: The specified service has been marked for deletion. See: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/20561990/how-to-solve-the-specified-service-has-been-marked-for-deletion-error
